name: White Fusion Calathea
description: Goeppertia lietzei, commonly known as White Fusion Calathea, is a stunning prayer plant native to Brazil. It features highly variegated leaves with splashes of green, white, and sometimes lilac or pink, creating a unique and eye-catching appearance. The leaves are oval to lance-shaped with a velvety texture. Like other prayer plants, the leaves fold up at night in a prayer-like motion (nyctinasty). The plant displays a compact, bushy growth habit and is highly prized for its striking variegation. It requires high humidity and consistent care, making it a challenging but rewarding addition to terrariums.
careTips: Provide bright, indirect light - direct sun will fade variegation
Maintain very high humidity (75-90%) - essential for this plant
Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged
Use filtered or distilled water to avoid leaf browning
Leaves fold up at night - this is normal
Fertilize monthly during growing season with diluted fertilizer
Can be sensitive to tap water - use filtered water
